channel.title: Looking for good old games
channel.description: Hello everyone! As the title said, I'm looking for some good "old" games, like the first Unreal (the single player one), half-life, Quake or Doom. Or it can be any other genre, I just want to have some fun because the games nowdays bore me to death. Any kind of suggestion would make me happy, so go ahead! Thank you in advance!

Just got it, ty for the info. I played FO1 but never actually owned it

item.title: Looking for good old games
item.dc:creator: Aze
item.description:
Dalek:

have you gotten the latest patches? I had a problem with Thief 1/2 that i fixed by changing the video settings… try playing around with those

Yep, as I said I patched up to the latest and got an XP fix also

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for good old games
item.dc:creator: Dalek
item.description:
Aze:

Guys I’m having some epic problems with System Shock 2 :
I got through the starting error easily with a patch and an XP fix, but after that came a lot bigger problem. The game freezes as soon as I enter the menu. I start the game, it works fine, as soon as I enter the menu to save or to change display or controlls or anything, and want to return to the game, it stops and nothing works, no ctrl+alt+del, no AltF4, no windows button, no nothing. I tried to google it but people don’t seem to experience the same thing I do. Any advice on that?

Edit: I run it on a “slow” pc, which I built for playing old games, so no dual or quad core, no epic video card, it’s a simple oldie PC which is good for these type of games, so the affinity error(changing from 2 core to 1) is not the issue here.

have you gotten the latest patches? I had a problem with Thief 1/2 that i fixed by changing the video settings… try playing around with those

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for good old games

Guys I’m having some epic problems with System Shock 2 :
I got through the starting error easily with a patch and an XP fix, but after that came a lot bigger problem. The game freezes as soon as I enter the menu. I start the game, it works fine, as soon as I enter the menu to save or to change display or controlls or anything, and want to return to the game, it stops and nothing works, no ctrl+alt+del, no AltF4, no windows button, no nothing. I tried to google it but people don’t seem to experience the same thing I do. Any advice on that?

Edit: I run it on a “slow” pc, which I built for playing old games, so no dual or quad core, no epic video card, it’s a simple oldie PC which is good for these type of games, so the affinity error(changing from 2 core to 1) is not the issue here.

item.title: Looking for good old games
item.dc:creator: Nerdguy
item.description:
robot_deodorant:

OpenRA
Not quite the Doom category, but it’s from an old game and it’s awesome…

It’s an open-source “enhanced” version of C&C: Red Alert AND the original C&C with internet multiplayer (but no campaign).

It supports modern resolutions and custom soundtracks, and since the games are freeware now, it’s completely legal. I tried it today and I didn’t have to wait long for some people to join my game, so I’m guessing it has a decent community.

Looks cool, gonna try it sometime

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for good old games
item.dc:creator: sIMson
item.description:
I suggest trying the very first Quake on DarkPlaces Engine. Here are some screenshots:

1600×900 401 KB

1600×900 353 KB

1600×900 344 KB

You can find hi-res textures here: https://qrp.quakeone.com/

Along with Trent Reznor’s soundtrack the old classic is pretty satisfying even for today’s standards

item.title: Looking for good old games
item.dc:creator: Gregorovich
item.description:
I’d have to recommend the first two Fallout games. The sense of immersion is leagues beyond the more recent shooter-type Fallouts, and there’s no constant hand-holding. It may take a little while to get used to the combat system but believe me they are the types of games that you will not get bored of quickly. Playing the old Fallouts is like watching an ad for the first iPhone - even though the tech is completely outdated, you are still as blown away as the people were at the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for good old games
item.dc:creator: Nightmare470
item.description:
If you’re into puzzle games, Myst and it’s sequel Riven. They’re older point and click and the first few games I ever played. Great stories and fun to just play and wind down with. Not quite “Old” but Fable the Lost Chapters was an incredibly enjoyable Fantasy RPG as well.

Read full topic

Maxey:

That series really needs a proper revival. If Raven themselves couldn’t do it, maybe Rockstar could buy the IP and finally make their first FPS.

Soldier of Fortune with its dismemberment and Euphoria animations.

item.title: Looking for good old games
item.dc:creator: CygNuS
item.description:
If you’re into Survival horror FPS, i’d suggest (Clive Barker’s) Undying.
The game won GameSpot’s 2001’s “Best game that no one played” award.

It sold poorly despite very positive reviews (https://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/clive-barkers-undying), however the atmosphere impressed me bigtime like Unreal and Half-Life did when I first played them. It genuinely felt like Alone In The Dark 1, but as an FPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for good old games
